document.masterDocTitle: Bees of the Hemihalictus series of Lasioglossum Curtis (Hymenoptera, Halictidae) in South Korea

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Bees of the Hemihalictus series of Lasioglossum Curtis (Hymenoptera, Halictidae) in South Korea

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Halictus apristus
Vachal 1903 : 130
[ Holotype : Muséum National d’ Histoire Naturelle , Paris , France ; ♀ , type locality = Nikkon Moyen , env. De Tokio et Alpes de Nikko (on label), Japan ]
. Lectotype designation by
Ebmer (1978b: 313)
is unnecessary (
Pesenko 2007b: 101
).

materialsCitation.treatmentCitationGroup:
Sphecodes pallidulus
Matsumura 1912 : 209
[ Syntype (s?): 1♀ in ELKU ; ♀ , type locality = Kumamoto , Japan , examined]. Synonymy by
Ebmer (1978b: 313)
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Evylaeus ( Evylaeus ) apristus :
Pesenko 2007b : 82
(in key), 87 (in key), 101, Figs 15–16 ( ♂ ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Female of this species is separated from other members of the
apristum
group by a combination of head and mesosoma with weak green-metallic luster and IS of mesoscutum with weak tessellation (sometimes nearly smooth in part) (IS = 3.5–5 d on medial to posterior area in maximum).

Distribution. North Korea , South Korea , Russian Far East, China , Japan , Taiwan .

Flight period in South Korea .
Female: April to August. Male: July to September.

Flower records in South Korea .
This species has been recorded visiting the following at least 11 plant species in seven families: Asteraceae :
Aster yomena
,
Sonchus
sp.,
Taraxacum
spp. Cornaceae :
Cornus
sp. Caprifoliaceae :
Lonicera
sp. Oleaceae :
Forsythia suspensa
. Polygonaceae :
Polygonum
sp. Rosaceae :
Armeniaca
sp.,
Crataegus
sp.,
Potentilla
sp. Salicaceae :
Salix
spp.
